VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during
this period under review.
Financial Overview
There are no financial concerns identified based on the review of the facility's audit
and budget.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
Not Applicable
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator documents that the facility changed the population that
was being served in 2021 to unaccompanied Children through Bethany Christian
Services. She also documents that only one youth was served and the program
officially closed in 11/30/23 after ORR discontinued the program. The Chief
Administrator noted that a contract with the Kalamazoo 9th circuit court was signed
on 7/1/25 for services to juvenile justice youth in the county system. There have
been no clients during this reporting period therefore no seclusions nor restraints
have occurred during this reporting period. The facility plans to begin taking
juvenile justice youth through the county court once they have hired and trained a
significant number of staff.
Staff and Youth Interviews
All staff interviewed were administrative staff and they report a belief that the new
program will help the juvenile justice youth in positive ways. They reported they
are still working on details to provide school for the youth either at the facility or the
juvenile home (has an in program school). They also reported feeling positive
about the outlook and hope to find enough appropriate staff.
No youth were interviewed since there are no youth in the program at this time.

Description of Agency Walk Through
This is a single-story facility well maintained and currently undergoing painting and
minor repairs. The building has not been used for a couple of years and is being
repainted. The bedrooms are furnished appropriately and a review of the building
will take place before any youth are allowed in the program. A change application
has been submitted, and an addendum will also be completed.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes. It is recommended that the agency be issued a renewal of their regular
license.
